result.execSummary:
The defendant Dion Lashay Byrd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bomb Scares, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.015.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with 52 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable assessments to be collected by DOC up to 25% from defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC up to 25% from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
-Pay all supervision fees.

12-16-16 correction to 12-14-16 entry:
the court vacates the sentencing of December 10, 2015

***12-14-2016, Court VACATES the sentencing of December 12, 2015. Defendant was re-sentenced.***

with credit for 52 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
-No contact with WITI Channel 6.
-No alcohol or illegal drugs. 
-No prescription medications without a valid prescription.

-Referral to the Mental Health Unit.
-Cooperate with agent.
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
-Follow all rules of extended supervision.
-Must take all prescribed medications.

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Date of original sentence that was vacated was incorrectly stated - December 12, 2015.  The correct date for the original sentencing date is December 10, 2016.

Defendant Dion Lashay Byrd in court with attorney Pamela Moorshead.  Defendant Dion Lashay Byrd in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter before the Court for re-sentencing.  Court VACATES the sentencing of December 12, 2015.  Sentencing arguments heard.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, with credit for 52 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable assessments to be collected by DOC up to 25% from defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC up to 25% from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Referral to the Mental Health Unit
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-No contact with WITI Channel 6
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-No prescription medications without a valid prescription
-Must take all prescribed medications 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
REVIEW OF MILWAUKEE MENTAL HEALTH COMPLEX RECORDS, AND RECORDS FROM DHS. FILED

Defendant Dion Lashay Byrd in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Richard S
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS with 52 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armour
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Dion Lashay Byrd in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called.  Court reviewed a juror issue with State and defense.  Jury in box at 9:14 am.  Sworn and testified:  Brown Deer police officer Jeanne Peterson.  Court addressed a jury question.  Sworn and testified:  Michelle B  Court addressed jury questions.  Sworn and testified:  Brown Deer police officer Melissa Fus.  Court addressed jury questions.  Jury out of box at 10:07 am.  At the close of the State's case defense motion to dismiss heard and denied.  Court made a record of sidebars.
Case recalled.    Defendant advised of right to testify and right to not testify.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of his right to testify.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Defense to rest. Defense motion to dismiss at the close of the case heard and denied.  Court reviews jury instructions with parties.  Jury in box at 10:37 am.  Defense rests on the record.  
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:18 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Roberto Hernandez and Andrew Heisel who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 11:49 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Jury Instructions, filed.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19 on 12/10/2015 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Dion Lashay Byrd in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New deputy court clerk:  vk  State's witness  Taylor S is testifying.  Sworn and testified for the State:  John W.  Court addressed jury questions.  Court recessed the jury at 4:30 pm and instructed to return next day to Branch 19.  Court made a record of sidebars.  Jury trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Court read the stipulation to the jury. Sworn for the state: Taylor S.

Defendant Dion Lashay Byrd in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Discussion regarding State's witnesses. Parties have reached a stipulation as to one of the State's witnesses. Court entered sequestration and exclusion orders.   Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:08 p.m.  Juror #25 excused. Voir dire continued. Court held in chambers discussion with both parties. Court instructed jury. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Jury out of the box: 3:14 p.m. Sidebars placed on the record. Court excused State's witness Michelle B. and ordered her to return to Branch 19 by 9:00 a.m. on 11/17/15. Jury in the box: 3:42 p.m. Jury sworn. Jury list received and filed.
